intro: Petroselinum selinoides, commonly known as swamp parsley, is a flowering plant native to wetland areas of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, feathery leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its small white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family, and it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Swamp parsley is valued for its culinary and medicinal properties, though it is less commonly cultivated than its relatives.
